answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that may be a helpful start.
This article from Daily Finance gives a brief history of the two technologies and the current growth of DAS.
http://www.dailyfinance.com/2011/03/22/the-incredible-shrinking-cellphone-tower-alcatel-lucent-offers/
Other communities have had similar discussions about cell towers vs. DAS technology.
This PowerPoint from the Town of Carefree, AZ provides an overview of their possible adoption of DAS technology and current cell towers. 
http://www.stopthequarrycelltower.com/uploads/carefreeAZ.pdf
The Village of Barrington Hills, IL faced a similar situation in 2010. You see a brief synopsis of their connectivity problem and eventual solution below. 
http://www.vbhcomm.info/news/hot_Cellular_Quality.php
A group of residents in Bethesda, MD are pushing for DAS technology in place of a proposed cell tower.
http://whitmanhighcelltower.blogspot.com/2010/03/alternative-to-cell-tower.html
A similar decision faced the Aquinnah/Gayhead, MA community in 2009. You may want to contact the community association directly for more information on their solution.
http://aghca.org/press/das-or-towers-west-tisbury-mixes-signals-over-wireless-plans/
Also, AT&T may be testing DAS technology in Palo Alto, CA as means to correct their network connections.
http://www.sidecutreports.com/2011/03/07/easy-das-it-palo-alto-or-how-att-is-using-small-antennas-to-fix-its-big-network-problems/
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Robert Kiely
text: Does anyone have any recent experience with a community's evaluation of DAS technology vs. cell towers? We are experiencing growing public opposition to anymore cell towers, insisting this is "old" technology and we should only permit DAS (Distributive Antenna Systems). Trying to balance need for adequate cell coverage with unsightly cell towers.
title: DAS vs. Cell Towers
